docs.title: Base de datos
docs.text:
Una tabla en MySQL es una estructura dentro de una base de datos que organiza los datos en filas y columnas, como si fuera una hoja de cálculo.

Cada fila (row) representa un registro individual, y cada columna (column) representa un campo de dato

Ejemplo: Una tabla alumnos podría tener columnas como id, nombre, edad, correo, etc., y cada fila representa un alumno distinto.

docs.title: Ejemplo de tabla en SQL
docs.text: ```sql title="Crear tabla alumnos" CREATE TABLE alumnos ( id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, nombre VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, edad INT, correo VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE );

docs.title: Threats and Vulnerabilities
docs.text:
Threat: harm, lost, damage or compromise info or system

  • Natural Disasters
  • Cyber-attacks
  • Data Integrity breaches
  • Disclosure of confidential information

Vulnerability: Any weakness in the system design or implementation They come from internal factors

  • Software bugs
  • Misconfigured software
  • Improperly protected network devices
  • Missing security patches
  • Lack of physical security

but it can be prevent from being exploited

  • Mitigating
  • Transferring, avoiding or accepting the risk (becomes a risk management decision)

Remember Neme: If I have:

  • Threat + No vulnerability = No Risk
  • Vulnerability + No threat = No Risk

Risk Management: Finding different ways to minimize the likelihood (probabilitie) of an outcome occurring and achieve the desired outcomes.

Cybersecurity is the continuity of services to the end users, maintaining the overall security of the systems and protect the organization from data breaches by minimizing the vulnerabilities or mitigating the risk it this impact.

docs.title: Confidentiality
docs.text:
Protect the information from unauthorized access and disclosure (Could be an individual, entity or process).

Keeping information secret and safe from prying eyes, only access who they need to access.

3 main reasons of Confidentiality

  1. Protect personal privacy
  2. Maintain a business advantage
  3. Achieve regulatory compliance (PII, PHI, Various types of financial data
  4. PII: Personal identifiable information, PHI: Protected health info.

How to maintain the Confidentiality

  1. Encryption
  2. Access Controls
  3. Data Masking
  4. Physical Security Measures
  5. Training and awareness

docs.title: Security Controls Categories
docs.text:
Multifaceted layers of protection to form a security posture

Main function to protect Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability

  1. Technical Controls: 

    HW and SW implemented to manage and reduce risk **(Firewalls, Encryption, Intrusion Detection Systems).**

  2. Managerial Controls or Administrative Controls:

    Strategic planning and governance side of security align to the business goal and risk tolerance **(conduct a risk assessments, security policies, training programs, incident response strategies for make decision and keep informed the organization in the same security page).

  3. Operational Controls:

    Procedures and measures designed to protect data  on a day to day basis most of them governed by internal processes and human actions **(change the passwd, backup procedures, account reviews, user training programs).** this can be ongoing process to ensure the security.

  4. Physical Controls: 

    Tangible, real-world measures taken to protect assets (digital and non-digital). Like**( Shredding of sensitive documents, Security guards, Locking doors).**

docs.title: Security Control Types
docs.text:
This will depend of the specific threat o vulnerability to address

1.- Preventive Controls: proactive measures, build foundation

proactive measures implemented to thwart potential security threats or breaches before the inciden occur **(firewall).**

2.- Deterrent Controls: discourage threats- warnings

Aim to discourage potential attackers by making the effort seem less appealing or more challenging. **( Warning Signs, banners to indicate the monitoring is occurring)**

3.- Detective Controls: detection and notification, watchful eye.

Monitor and alert to malicious activities as the occur or shortly thereafter. ** (Network: IDS (Intrusion-Detection-System).**

4.- Corrective Controls: jumping in emergencies

Mitigate any potential damage and restore the system to their normal state.**(mitigate the vulnerabilities).*

5.- Compensating Controls: backups and mitigations

Alternative measure implemented when primary security controls are not feasible or effective *(plan b of security)***example:*** in a test online: 3 layers of security network: my phone, cable dsl, wifi)

6.- Directive Controls: guide the entire process

    Policy or documentation that set the standards for behavior in the organization. **(policy how employs use company-owned IT assets).**

docs.title: Zero Trust   Never trust, always verify...
docs.text:
this mean we can not just trust to the network perimeter to protect the system as a main line of defense, with deperimeterization (common in cloud and remote work and adoption of new thecnologies)we are put a lot or risk into the organization that is why we need to focus on: strong authentication, data encryption access controls per user/devices, zero trust architecture.

Zero Trust: demands verify for every device, user and transaction within the network, regardless of its origin (it doesn't mater where it comes from: inside or outside the network.

1. Control Plane: is the brain (making decisions)

Adaptive Identity, threat scope reduction, policy-driven access control, secured zones with Policy Engine and Policy Administrator.

2. Data Plane: is the hands (doing the actual work) 

Subject/System and Policy Enforcement Point

docs.title: 1. Control Plane:  responsible for defining, managing, and enforcing the policies related to user and system access.
docs.text:
1 Adaptive Identity: validation into account user behavior, device, location and more.

2 Threat scope reduction: Limit he access only for the need work tasks, avoid risk and compromise credentials.

3 Policy-driven access control: Enforce user access policies based on their roles and responsibilities.

4 Secured zones: Isolated environments within a network that are designed to house sensitive data.

Control Planes uses: Policy Engine and Policy Administrator to makes security decisions like:

  • is the user allowed to access this app?
  • is this devices secure enough to connect?
  • Should this request be blocked or allowed?
    1 Policy Engine: cross-references the access request with its predefined policies.

2 Policy Administrator:  Used to establish and manage the access policies, aligning with the organization security protocols and business objectives.

docs.title: 2. Data Plane: data traffic flows: like emails, files or apps requests between users, devices and services.
docs.text:
1.- Subject/System: the objective is verify the authenticity of the subject or system. Refers to the individual or entity attempting to gain access: employee, a workstation or software application..

2.- Policy Enforcement Point:  Allow or restrict access act as a gatekeeper to sensitive areas of systems and networks.

Gap Analysis

Process of evaluating the differences between an organization's current performance and its desired performance.

docs.title: Resume
docs.text: • Dedicated compliance with over 5 years of IT cyber security experience to be in compliance with regulatory requirements, internal policies, and industry standards. aligning to security and compliance frameworks such as ISO27001, NIST SOX, GDPR, CCPA, HIPA and related regulations. Scrum Master over 2 years of experience applying Agile methodologies to enhance team performance, coordinate activities across the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and manage End Support (L1,L2, L3) to delivery of high-quality results for Financially Significant (FinSig), SOX-compliant applications and architecture.

docs.title: WORK EXPERIENCE
docs.text:
• IBM Remote 2013-2024

Scrum Master 2022-2024 Led cross-functional team 10-13 members across the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and managed End Support (L1, L2,L3) to deliver high-quality results for Financially Significant (FinSig), SOX-compliant applications. Collaborated and tracked progress with the development team on a migration project, transitioning one legacy application into a module integrated with the main application on Cloud systems. This consolidation reduced security risks, streamlined procedures, improved documentation, financial costs, etc. Collaborated with the Product Owner to maintain and refine the product backlog and analyzed the impact of the business requirements to develop Epics using Jira to documented issues, changes and new requeriments. Provided regular updates to all stakeholders on project status. Implemented and maintained Agile metrics using Jira enhancing team visibility and Program Manager reviews. Coordinated Agile ceremonies: daily standups, sprint planning, story refinement and retrospectives

Compliance Analyst- 2020-2024 Managed 8 applications to ensure compliance with the IT Security Standards. Financially Significant (FinSig)/SarbanesOxley(SOX) some of them and NIST CSF and CISSP. Operated access management processes: Access, Remove, Modify,Employment Verification, Continued Business Need Revalidation, Reconciliation, Separation of Duties for legacy (mainframe), cloud, Github and web apps using internal tools IBM Registration Tool (IRT), AccessHub, Bluegroups, CLAS, IBM Tivoli Identity Manager and Servicenow. Led the incident management process using ServiceNow, PagerDuty, Jira ensuring timely resolution of security incidents, change, problems and performed the RCA when needed. Managed quarterly compliance reviews MSAC assessment (process),PAC Assessment (Upgrades, Sunset, Access Management, Change Management Tools, etc.), GPA(Confidential data). Documented security and operations procedures (Gaps, Control Points, Audit Controls, Disaster Recovery, On-offboarding, sunset, etc.) using IBM Docs, IBM Blueworks Live, Microsoft Visio and MkDocs deployed using GitHub Pages. Managed the Vulnerability Management process through proactive scanning using a centralized dashboard; evaluated impact, prioritized findings, and coordinated with teams to ensure timely remediation across Infrastructure, OS, and Middleware using ASoC, AppScan, Contrast, Mend, Dynatrace, SonarQube, and Twistlock. Identified and mitigated potential risks through the risk assessments and meetings. Collaborated with the Product Owner to prioritized the security requirements and team collaboration during audits & reviews. Managed internal and external audits, compliance reviews (PwC404 and Deloitte) and data protection per GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA (One Trust). Managed compliance and access controls for applications on IBMZ mainframes (z/OS) using RACF and enterprise tools.

Security Business Analyst- 2018-2020 Led vulnerability management by coordinating with infrastructure and security teams to ensure timely remediation across Infrastructure, OS, and Middleware. Evaluating and prioritizing patches based often using CVSS scores Generated reports for operations teams and business managers to track metrics, remediation progress and compliance using internal tools and dashboards to perform comprehensive vulnerability assessments. Continuously monitored systems for vulnerabilities, implementing remediation processes to ensure security posture. Conducted risk assessments to evaluate potential impacts and created documentation to enforce appropriate security protocols.

IT Service Delivery Manager- 2016-2018 Managed incident, problem, change and release management of some applications running AIX, LInux and Windows, WAS, IBM MQ, Infosphere, DB2, and SaaS (Softlayer). Collaborated directly with the customer for new and existing services. Performed reviews, delegating tasks and responsibilities to appropriate worldwide teams 24 x7 support. (Administration OS, Middleware, Security, Compliance, and Administrative processes in the Customer environment).

System Administrator - 2013-2016 Administered Windows, AIX, and Linux servers, Cloud, VMware, IBM Middleware WebSphere, DB2, MQ, Tivoli, Domino and SPSS. Performed regular system health checks: monitored processes, CPU utilization, memory usage, load averages, disk utilization, access management, vulnerability management process ensuring compliance with industry standards and other key metrics to ensure system stability. Performed Troubleshooting, created/maintained technical documentation, including system configurations, user guides, backup and disaster recovery plans. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to handle incidents, changes, and service requests in development and production environments using internal applications and ServiceNow to manage tasks based on priority and SLAs ensuring timely resolution of issues. SME for IBM SPSS support in installation, configuration, and maintenance across enterprise environments collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure performance and creating technical documentation.

System Administrator- (On-site)- UACH - 2006-2013 Preventive and corrective maintenance computer equipment (Windows, ContpaQ, SPSS, Active directory). Managed client-server support through thin clients running on Solaris, monitoring memory usage, disk space, and load balancing to optimize system performance. Provided L3 support Windows, linux and VMWARE infrastructure (virtual machines) for end users.

IT College Professor (Remote)- UACH 2008-Today Implement innovative online courses to enhance student engagement and improve learning outcomes using platforms and tools such as Moodle, HubSpot, Canva, Collaboration tools and Google Workspace to deliver interactive and effective online teaching

  • EDUCATION Bachelor’s Degree Bachelors Degree in Computer Systems Administration | University of Chihuahua | 2002-2006

  • CERTIFICATIONS Generative AI for Educators Certificate | Google | 2025 Certification in progress CompTIA IT Fundamentals (FCO-U61) | Udemy | 2025 Certification in progress CompTIA IT Fundamentals (FCO-U61) | Udemy | 2025 Technical Owner Certified |IBM| 2022 Scrum Master Certification | Scrum.org | 2020 Scrum Fundamentals Certification | Scrum.org | 2016 HIPAA | 2019

  • COURSES CISSP | Udemy | 2025 Course ISO 27001 |Udemy |2024 Course ITIL 4 | Udemy | 2024

  • LANGUAGE Spanish Native | English (Fluent for business)

  • SKILLS Problem Solving, Time Management, Teamwork and Collaboration, Adaptability

docs.title: 📋 Comandos de Gestión de Usuarios en Linux
🧑‍💻 Gestión de Usuarios
docs.text:
Comando Descripción sudo useradd nombre_usuario Crea un nuevo usuario. sudo useradd -m nombre_usuario Crea usuario y su directorio personal. sudo passwd nombre_usuario Asigna o cambia la contraseña del usuario. sudo userdel nombre_usuario Elimina un usuario (sin borrar su home). sudo userdel -r nombre_usuario Elimina usuario y su carpeta personal. sudo usermod -l nuevo_nombre antiguo_nombre Cambia el nombre de un usuario. sudo usermod -d /nueva/ruta nombre_usuario Cambia el directorio personal. sudo usermod -aG grupo nombre_usuario Añade usuario a un grupo sin quitar los anteriores. sudo usermod -L nombre_usuario Bloquea al usuario. sudo usermod -U nombre_usuario Desbloquea al usuario. sudo chage -l nombre_usuario info extendida el usuario, se necesita instalar 
    Vpena:x:1001:1001:Viviana Pena /home/Vpena/bin/bash
    Vpena: nombre del usuario
    X: contraseña encriptada (etc/shadow)
    1001: UID
    1001: GID
    Viviana Pena: descripción
    /home/Vpena: carpeta personal
    /bin/bash: shell predeterminado

docs.title: 🔍 Consultar Información de Usuarios
docs.text:
Comando Descripción id nombre_usuario Muestra UID, GID y grupos del usuario. groups nombre_usuario Muestra los grupos del usuario. getent passwd nombre_usuario Muestra entrada completa del usuario desde /etc/passwd. grep nombre /etc/passwd Busca información del usuario en el archivo passwd. chage -l nombre_usuario Muestra información sobre caducidad de contraseña. who Muestra quién está conectado. w Muestra quién está conectado y qué está haciendo. last Muestra historial de inicios de sesión. users Lista los usuarios conectados. su nombre_usuario Cambia al usuario especificado. 
    Para ver todos los usuarios del sistema:
    ```bash
    cut -d: -f1 /etc/passwd

docs.title: 🧾 Archivos del Sistema Relacionados
docs.text: Archivo Contenido /etc/passwd Información básica de los usuarios. /etc/shadow Contraseñas cifradas y fechas de expiración. /etc/group Información de grupos del sistema. /etc/skel/ Archivos predeterminados para nuevos usuarios. /etc/login.defs Configuración de políticas para usuarios nuevos.

docs.title: 👥 Gestión de Grupos
docs.text: Comando Descripción sudo groupadd nombre_grupo Crea un nuevo grupo. sudo groupdel nombre_grupo Elimina un grupo. sudo groupmod -n nuevo_nombre nombre_actual Cambia el nombre de un grupo. sudo gpasswd -a usuario grupo Añade un usuario al grupo. sudo gpasswd -d usuario grupo Elimina un usuario del grupo.

docs.title: Mkdocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org. https://www.mkdocs.org/user-guide/writing-your-docs/

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
  • http://127.0.0.1:8000/database/

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
• mkdocs.yml The configuration file.
  • docs/index.md The documentation homepage.*
  • ... Other markdown pages, images and other files.
  • Note when the txt does not allow to save as .md save it : save as "file_name.md" (between double quote)

docs.title: Command  What it does
docs.text:
• mkdocs serve Preview docs live at http://127.0.0.1:8000/
  • mkdocs build Builds the updated site into the site/ folder
  • mkdocs gh-deploy Publishes your changes to GitHub Pages
  • Run on gitbash

docs.title: Workflow Summary
docs.text:
Edit your .md files in docs/

  • Update mkdocs.yml to reflect new pages
  • Run mkdocs serve to preview
  • Run git add ., git commit -m "...", git push
  • Deploy with mkdocs gh-deploy

My mkdocs link https://vpenat81.github.io/vpenadocs/

docs.title: Bloques de código
docs.text: Usa el comando git status para ver los cambios.

docs.title: Desplegar en GitHub Pages
docs.text:
• checar el repositorio en GitHub (público o privado).
  • ejecutar en la carpeta de donde esta vpenadocs
  • C:\Users\neme_\vpena-docs> mkdocs gh-deploy
  • Para forzar el deploy: mkdocs gh-deploy --force
  • ir a mi ghpages: https://vpenat81.github.io/vpenadocs/ link

docs.title: Opcional pero recomendable si no carga en github
docs.text:
1 Limpia tu sitio local - Windows powershell: rmdir /s /q site - Linux bash: rm -rf site

2 Reconstruye tu sitio - mkdocs build - mkdocs gh-deploy --force (le dice a MkDocs que reemplace lo que ya está en la rama gh-pages, incluso si no detecta cambios)
